alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:27AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Miami-Dade County through NOON EDT... At 1127 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palmetto Bay, or near Black Point. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coral Gables, South Miami, Black Point, Kendall, Pinecrest, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, West Perrine, Goulds, Richmond Heights, Glenvar Heights, The Falls, Howard, Palmetto Estates and South Miami Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
